security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and examples for the Seaborn statistical visualization library. No executable code, network operations, or file system access patterns were detected. The content is purely educational and reference material.

content.value_statement: Struggling to choose the right statistical plot for your data? This skill guides Seaborn choices, parameters, and layouts for clear, publication-ready figures. Learn to create scatter plots, box plots, violin plots, heatmaps, and faceted visualizations with expert guidance.
actual_capabilities: Recommend appropriate Seaborn plot types for data distributions, relationships, and categorical comparisons
Explain axes-level versus figure-level functions and when to use each approach
Guide semantic mappings using hue, size, and style encodings for multi-dimensional data
Provide instructions for faceting with FacetGrid, PairGrid, and JointGrid
Outline theme, palette, and context settings for publication-quality figures
Demonstrate integration with matplotlib for advanced customization
limitations: Requires Python environment with seaborn and matplotlib installed to execute code
Cannot render or display visualizations directly - only provides code examples
Does not create interactive dashboards or web-based visualizations
Needs user-provided data or column names to provide specific recommendations
Focuses on static plots, not animated or interactive graphics

use_cases.title: Explore relationships quickly
use_cases.description: Identify the best Seaborn plots to examine correlations, trends, and distributions when exploring a new dataset.

use_cases.title: Build publication figures
use_cases.description: Apply appropriate themes, color palettes, and multi-panel layouts for publication-ready statistical graphics.

use_cases.title: Learn plot selection
use_cases.description: Get guidance on which Seaborn functions match your variable types and analysis goals for assignments.

prompt_templates.title: Choose a plot type
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner deciding how to visualize two variables
prompt_templates.prompt: I have columns total_bill and tip with a category day. Which Seaborn plot should I use and why?

prompt_templates.title: Add semantic mappings
prompt_templates.prompt: Suggest how to encode time as hue and size in a scatterplot using Seaborn, and explain key parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Facet a dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to facet by sex and time for a relational plot, and explain figure-level settings.

prompt_templates.title: Polish for publication
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend Seaborn theme, palette, and context settings for a publication figure, with rationale.

output_examples.input: I want to compare distributions across categories and highlight subgroups.
output: Use a violin plot or box plot to compare category distributions
Add a strip or swarm layer to show individual points
Map subgroup to hue and set dodge for side-by-side comparison
Choose a colorblind-safe palette for clarity
Consider faceting if you have many categories

best_practices: Use long-form data for flexible variable mapping and faceting
Match plot type to your variable types and analysis goals
Set theme and context early for consistent styling across plots
anti_patterns: Using wide-form data for complex multi-variable plots
Overloading one plot with too many semantic mappings
Relying on default binning without checking distribution shape

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides Seaborn guidance that works across all these platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not run code or render plots. It provides guidance and code examples only.

faq.question: Can I integrate the guidance into my notebook workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Copy the suggestions directly into Python notebooks with seaborn and matplotlib installed.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data or files?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the details you provide in your prompt text.

faq.question: What if my plot looks cluttered or unreadable?
faq.answer: Reduce semantic mappings, use faceting, or adjust themes and palettes for better clarity.

faq.question: How does this compare to general plotting help?
faq.answer: It focuses on Seaborn-specific functions, parameters, and statistical plotting patterns.
